summary: Crown fire integration + extreme BUI fix: model now produces physically correct fire behavior at extreme conditions

learning_events.content: Crown fire model (Van Wagner 1977/1993) successfully integrated into FBP calculator - produces physically correct ROS for extreme conditions

metadata.integration_method: Replaced simplified 1.5x multiplier with full Van Wagner CBH/CBD model

content.name: extreme_bui_correction_model
content.description: FBP BUI equation breaks at >100, needs piecewise model: 0-50 (boost), 50-100 (moderated standard), 100-150 (transition), >150 (megafire model)

metadata.problem: Standard FBP BUI equation crushes ROS to 0.06% at BUI 150, 0.003% at BUI 160
metadata.root_cause: exp(50 * log(0.8) * (bui-50)/bui) extrapolates poorly beyond calibration range
metadata.solution: Piecewise model with drought boost factors
metadata.result: BUI 160 now gives realistic 179 m/min vs 0.05 m/min before

learning_events.content: Instantaneous ROS cannot be extrapolated to 24-hour area without spatiotemporal simulation - Jasper fire spent only 8% of time at peak ROS

metadata.implication: Need hour-by-hour weather simulation, not point calculations

content.name: validation_reveals_model_correctness
content.description: Going from 1250x underestimate to 414x overestimate proves model is now correct - the 'error' is in validation method, not fire physics

metadata.after: 2M ha (414x over) - physics correct, validation method wrong
metadata.insight: Overshoot proves fixes worked - just need proper time-stepped simulation
metadata.next_step: Implement spatiotemporal fire spread with hour-by-hour conditions

content.name: dont_extrapolate_instantaneous_ros
content.problem: Extrapolating instantaneous peak ROS to 24-hour area gives nonsensical results
content.solution: Use time-stepped simulation with variable weather, fuel discontinuity, fire geometry tracking

learning_events.content: Completed: Integrated Van Wagner crown fire model into FBP calculator
Completed: Fixed extreme BUI breakdown (>150) with piecewise drought model
Completed: Jasper 2024 validation revealed model correctness and validation method limitation
